docs.lead_paragraph: A proposed new anti-abortion law that would ban a common second-trimester abortion procedure was temporarily blocked Wednesday, but an Oklahoma judge declined to halt a second law increasing the waiting period for women seeking an abortion.

headline.main: Oklahoma Judge Halts 1 Abortion Law, Lets Another Stand
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma Judge Halts 1 Abortion Law, Lets Another Stand

docs.snippet: A proposed new anti-abortion law that would ban a common second-trimester abortion procedure was temporarily blocked Wednesday, but an Oklahoma judge declined to halt a second law increasing the waiting period for women seeking an abortion.

docs.lead_paragraph: The American Civil Liberties Union on Wednesday accused a Catholic hospital in Michigan of failing to provide appropriate care by refusing on religious grounds to allow a pregnant woman with a brain tumor to be sterilized.

headline.main: Michigan Catholic Hospital Failed to Help Woman With Brain Tumor: Complaint
headline.print_headline: Michigan Catholic Hospital Failed to Help Woman With Brain Tumor: Complaint

docs.snippet: The American Civil Liberties Union on Wednesday accused a Catholic hospital in Michigan of failing to provide appropriate care by refusing on religious grounds to allow a pregnant woman with a brain tumor to be sterilized.

docs.abstract: Women living near hydraulic fracturing (or “fracking”) operations were more likely to have premature babies than those living farther away.
docs.snippet: Women living near hydraulic fracturing (or “fracking”) operations were more likely to have premature babies than those living farther away.

docs.lead_paragraph: The decision was meant to combat videos contending that officials sought to profit from the programs, which provide fetal tissue to researchers.

headline.main: Planned Parenthood Won’t Accept Money for Fetal Tissue
headline.print_headline: Planned Parenthood Changes Fetal Tissue Policy

docs.abstract: Planned Parenthood announces it will no longer accept reimbursement for costs of providing fetal tissue to medical researchers, in attempt to quell uproar over practice that has led to Republican accusations and series of investigations; anti-abortion groups hail decision as victory, but organization says move is practical decision and attempt to return to its daily business; organization also reiterates that of its nearly 700 health centers nationwide, only two supply fetal tissue to researchers and only one has been getting reimbursed.
docs.snippet: The decision was meant to combat videos contending that officials sought to profit from the programs, which provide fetal tissue to researchers.

headline.main: Women With Essure Contraceptive Implant Needed More Surgeries, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Women With Essure Sterilization Implant Needed More Surgery, Researchers Say

docs.abstract: Women who sought sterilization through the Essure implant were far more likely to be back for surgery within a year than women who had their tubes tied, the study found.
docs.snippet: Women who sought sterilization through the Essure implant were far more likely to be back for surgery within a year than women who had their tubes tied, the study found.

docs.lead_paragraph: Eric T. Schneiderman has begun an inquiry into whether Turing Pharmaceuticals violated antitrust rules by restricting distribution of a drug, Daraprim, as a way to thwart generic competition.

headline.main: New York Attorney General Examining Whether Turing Restricted Drug Access
headline.print_headline: New York Attorney General Examining if Turing Restricted Drug Access

docs.abstract: New York State Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman starts investigation into Turing Pharmaceuticals, who skyrocketed price of infection drug, causing backlash against high pharmaceutical prices.
docs.snippet: Eric T. Schneiderman has begun an inquiry into whether Turing Pharmaceuticals violated antitrust rules by restricting distribution of a drug, Daraprim, as a way to thwart generic competition.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Somogyi danced George Balanchine’s “Liebeslieder Walzer,” then the audience and her colleagues showed their appreciation for her career.

headline.main: Review: Jennie Somogyi Stirs Memories in Her City Ballet Goodbye

docs.abstract: Alastair Macaulay reviews farewell dance performance by New York City Ballet ballerina Jennie Somogyi at David H Koch Theater.
docs.snippet: Ms. Somogyi danced George Balanchine’s “Liebeslieder Walzer,” then the audience and her colleagues showed their appreciation for her career.

docs.lead_paragraph: The woman, whose attack was said to have occurred outside a processing center for asylum seekers on the island of Nauru, had sought an abortion in Australia.

headline.main: Pregnant Asylum Seeker Who Said She Was Raped on Nauru Is in Australia for Care
headline.print_headline: Pregnant Asylum Seeker Who Says She Was Raped Enters Australia for Medical Care

docs.abstract: Australia grants visa to pregnant Somali woman who claims she was raped while detained on island of Nauru, where asylum seekers arriving by boat are held until their applications are processed; woman requested to come to Australia to have abortion, which Nauru prohibits; medical professionals and activists decry conditions at detention center.
docs.snippet: The woman, whose attack was said to have occurred outside a processing center for asylum seekers on the island of Nauru, had sought an abortion in Australia.

docs.lead_paragraph: John Legend and Chrissy Teigen are expecting their first child.

headline.main: John Legend, Chrissy Teigen Announce Pregnancy
headline.print_headline: John Legend, Chrissy Teigen Announce Pregnancy

docs.lead_paragraph: Crisis pregnancy centers that discourage women from getting abortions are suing to block a new law that would make California the first state to require them to provide information about abortions.

headline.main: Pregnancy Centers Sue to Block Abortion Information Law
headline.print_headline: Pregnancy Centers Sue to Block Abortion Information Law

docs.snippet: Crisis pregnancy centers that discourage women from getting abortions are suing to block a new law that would make California the first state to require them to provide information about abortions.
